page.title: 05FREE TIME - WYKE'S YOUTH
page.content: A leisure time survey also discovered that there are still many seasonal games played by younger children. Conker tournaments are common in autumn and marbles in early spring. The cold, frosty weather of winter provides perfect sliding conditions within the playground, and any fall of snow sees sledging, snowball fights and the building of snowmen. Skipping is very popular with girls. As teenagers, new interests develop. Football and watching television are still very popular, but going to youth clubs and discotheques grows in importance. A recent new trend is break dancing. Here, groups of boys gather together and, accompanied by music from a transistor radio, they challenge one another to a duel of dancing. Individually they perform a
